full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 751 Filed 08/10/22 Page 203 of 261 1364 LC6VMAX6 Maguire - direct residence? Q. What happened next? A. When we first arrived, we knocked and announced our presence for the execution of the search warrant. Q. What happened next? A. After we did not receive a response from any occupants inside, we then forced entry into the residence. Q. After you made entry into the residence, what's the next thing that happened in the search? A. My team conducted a protective sweep. Q. Can you explain for the jury what is a protective sweep. A. A protective sweep is when the team moves through the residence to ensure that there are no additional threats to law enforcement on scene, particularly from occupants. Q. Were there any issues during the protective sweep? A. No, there was not. Q. How did the search proceed from there? A. At that point we then label each room in the residence, and then we began photographing the residence as it was. We viewed it before a search took place. Q. I think you mentioned just now that you labeled the different rooms. Can you explain for the jury what that means. A. So that we know where certain items are being found throughout the residence, we then designate each room by a letter of the alphabet. Q. Approximately how many rooms were inside the residence that SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00012954
